Learn why mantras will make a powerful addition to your meditation practice – and find which one(s) work best for you.

node.text:
🟡 5 Lessons on the unknown, from the yellow dot:⁠
1. It's not as easy as a pinch and zoom ⁠
2. We must cultivate comfort with not knowing what's next⁠
3. This includes releasing control⁠
4. #3 is made easier when we trust that The Universe always has our best interest at heart (even when it doesn't feel like it)⁠
5. When we surrender to the outcome, we make room for something better⁠
⁠
Your turn... what's something you've learned about the unknown?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mind-Body Health & Well-Being on August 04, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HELLO, I'm irri tated @CHOPRA'.

node.text:
Not-so nice to meet you, irritated. 😉  Can anyone relate? Let us help...⁠
⁠
If hot n' fiery Pitta season has you feeling a little agitated, you're right on schedule. Ayurveda teaches us how to adjust our routine and the things we eat and drink to cool down and find balance.⁠
⁠
Join us in the Chopra App for Dr. Sheila's new "Summer Renewal" series under "Personalized Practices." You'll even get a free e-book with tips and recipes to help you stay cool for the rest of summer and beyond. 🙌 Link in bio.

node.text:
Ready for a steady stream of peace in your life? 😌 Let us introduce you to *Ayurvedic bodywork* – an ancient and powerful tool for bringing body, mind, and soul into harmonious balance.

“While traditional Swedish massage works primarily on the physical level, Ayurvedic bodywork addresses multiple layers of your being. From exfoliating dead skin cells, moving lymphatic fluids, and erasing muscular tension to balancing doshic elements, dissolving ama (toxic residue in the body and mind), and mitigating the stress response, Ayurvedic treatments have a long history of facilitating physical health, emotional well-being, and soul connection.” –Erin Easterly, Chopra Certified Ayurvedic Lifestyle Instructor

👉 The word shirodhara originates from two Sanskrit words, shiro (head) and dhara (flow). It is a form of treatment in which warm, herbalized Ayurvedic oil is poured onto your forehead.

Therapeutic Benefits of Shirodhara:
1. Counteracts the Effects of Stress
2. Reduces Anxiety
3. Awakens Intuition
4. Improves Sleep Quality
5. Pacifies Vata Dosha

Experience daily Ayurvedic spa treatments and much more at our Whole Health Retreat at @CivanaResort in Carefree, Arizona. 🌵 Hosted twice monthly – explore the schedule at chopra.com/retreats/whole-health-retreat

node.text:
Drop an emoji below n' swipe right if you like routine. ✅⁠⁠
⁠⁠
While for many, summer may be a little more relaxed when it comes to daily to-dos, having a good routine in place can help keep you cool and balanced during the more casual summer months. 🌞⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Summer is Pitta season,🔥 which may cause a buildup of heat in the body that can lead to heartburn and inflammation, irritability, intensity, and more. The way you eat, drink, and even exercise can help you find the balance your body needs. Try this routine, or create one of your own to stay centered for the remainder of summer.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mind-Body Health & Well-Being on July 29, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Try this cool summer routine to calm your mind, body, and spirit 木不不 @CHOPRA'.

Photo by Mind-Body Health & Well-Being on July 29, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Afternoon: Listen to soft, rhythmic music or sound bowls as you start your daily tasks Look at nature every chance you get *bonus: feet on earth Eat a refreshing lunch with cooling herbs i.e. cilantro, mint, dill Sip on coconut water throughout the day Try this affirmation: Today, choose peace @CHOPRA'.
